intro: Seriola albicans, commonly known as the silver seriola, is a marine fish species belonging to the family Serranidae. It is characterized by its silver-scaled body and a distinctive white lateral line. This fish typically inhabits coastal waters and is found in the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. Seriola albicans is known for its fast growth rate and is often cultivated in aquaculture for its high-quality flesh. The plant aspect is not applicable, as Seriola albicans is a fish, not a plant.
